decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly building up a powerful, hexproof creature by attaching multiple auras to it, making it difficult for the opponent to target or deal with. By protecting the creature with a mix of auras like Rancor, Spider Umbra, and Sippery Bogle, while also gaining life and buffs from cards like Unflinching Courage and Ethereal Armor, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a highly aggressive and resilient threat. Leyline of Sanctity provides extra protection against targeted removal, while Path to Exile offers some removal options for opposing threats.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence of powerful Merfolk creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Master of Waves, Merrow Reejerey, and Lord of Atlantis to pump up the team and generate tokens. Spreading Seas disrupts opponent's mana base while Aether Vial allows for flash creatures to be played at instant speed. The deck also includes control elements like Cryptic Command and Kopala, Warden of Waves to protect its creatures. With a mix of aggression and disruption, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

This UWx Midrange Control deck focuses on utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and impactful creatures to control the game and outvalue opponents. With versatile cards like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to disrupt enemy strategies while applying pressure with threats like Spell Queller and Geist of Saint Traft. By carefully managing resources and leveraging the flexibility of the spells in the deck, the pilot can dictate the pace of the game and ultimately come out on top through smart decision-making and skillful play.

The main concept of this Mardu Aggro deck revolves around aggressive creature plays, burn spells, and hand disruption to quickly overwhelm and control the opponent. By utilizing cards like Young Pyromancer and Monastery Swiftspear to generate tokens, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate, the deck aims to apply constant pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan through cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The inclusion of Bedlam Reveler allows for card advantage and refilling the hand, ensuring the deck can maintain its aggressive tempo throughout the game.

This UWx Midrange deck focuses on classic control elements such as countering spells, removing threats, and managing card advantage. The deck uses a combination of efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt, as well as powerful counterspells like Cryptic Command. The deck also utilizes versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. By maintaining control of the board and card advantage, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents in a longer game.

The deck focuses on quickly generating spells and mana to cast multiple spells in one turn, ultimately leading to a lethal Grapeshot or massive storm count. By utilizing cards like Pyretic Ritual, Desperate Ritual, and Manamorphose to generate mana, along with Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce costs, the deck aims to cast a high impact Past in Flames to recur spells and create a storm of spells, finishing off opponents with a massive Grapeshot. The deck also uses Gifts Ungiven to find key combo pieces and maintain consistency.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble a board of Elves and use their synergy to generate a large amount of mana, allowing for explosive plays such as casting multiple Collected Companies or Chords of Calling in a single turn. The presence of combo pieces like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies enables the player to potentially generate infinite mana and use Ezuri, Renegade Leader's ability to create an overwhelming board state and overwhelming the opponent in a single turn. The deck's game plan is to overwhelm the opponent quickly before they have a chance to react.

The main concept of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to overwhelm your opponent with fast and efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. By using cards like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Lava Spike, you can deal direct damage to your opponent while also controlling the board with cards like Searing Blaze. Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel provide additional damage and pressure to quickly close out the game before your opponent has a chance to stabilize. This deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively through aggressive tactics.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of low-cost artifact creatures and utilizing the synergy between them and artifact-related spells. It aims to buff up these creatures with Cranial Plating and pump them with Steel Overseer, while also utilizing Galvanic Blast for direct damage. The deck also includes cards like Etched Champion and Master of Etherium for additional power and protection. The mana base includes a mix of colored and colorless lands to support the various spells in the deck.

The main concept of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures and burn spells. By combining fast land fetches with low-cost spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear can also chip in with early damage, while Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for playing spells. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around being aggressive and burning the opponent down before they can stabilize.

The deck revolves around accelerating mana production and searching for specific land cards to quickly assemble the Valakut combo, which deals lethal damage to the opponent when activated. It includes cards to prevent opponent graveyard manipulation and disrupt their strategy, while also applying pressure with creatures and removal spells. The goal is to efficiently ramp up to the necessary lands and cards to win the game through the Valakut combo.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively lower your own life total in order to power up Death's Shadow, a powerful threat that grows in size as your life total decreases. Utilizing cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize to lower your life total quickly, combined with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Dismember to control the board, and counterspells like Stubborn Denial to protect your threats, this deck aims to apply early pressure and close out the game quickly with a massive Death's Shadow.

The main focus of this deck is to use the combo of Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Deceiver Exarch/Pestermite to create infinite creature tokens with haste, allowing for a game-winning attack in a single turn. The deck also includes control elements like Counterspells and removal to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to efficiently draw cards, control the board, and assemble the combo pieces while ensuring a strong game plan to win quickly with the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through countering and removing opponent's threats while deploying its own powerful creatures like Geist of Saint Traft and Spell Queller. The deck aims to gain card advantage and control the board with cards like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage. The mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck is designed to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while pressuring them with efficient threats to secure victory in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting, utilizing the Dredge mechanic to continuously return cards like Stinkweed Imp to the hand. By recurring creatures like Narcomoeba and Bloodghast, the deck aims to swarm the board with high-value threats like Prized Amalgam. Conflagrate and other burn spells can be used for reach and to clear the board. The key strategy is to abuse the graveyard as a resource to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly summoning powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards such as Eldrazi Temple and Urza lands to ramp up mana production, along with tools like Chalice of the Void and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's strategy, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence with creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer to close out the game swiftly. The inclusion of removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust provides additional support for keeping the opponent in check while the Eldrazi creatures deliver the finishing blows.
